column4: Does anyone know why "apt-get update" would return "404 - not found" for some of the repos?
try doing an apt-get update
that is what returns 404 - but if archive does not include arm, then it's obvious wha it returns 404...
are you using an ARM processor?
yep...
apt-get update does that?
yes... but if rww is right about the normal repos not having arm, it does so rightfully...
yeah but the packaging system is based on debain which has been ported to toasters and blenders :) Seems your apt is setup to look in the wrong place, im not really sure how to fix it
at least now i know what's wrong... and i can take it from there...
is your router blocking icmp traffic? Some call it "DDoS Protection"
said router works well with every other device in the network
did you put a tick in the "available to all users" box?
yes
'iwconfig'
can you connect and use other routers?
i only have that one. I could try connection to the android hot spot from my mobile...
could be a bad password or such if its only the one router giving you trouble
ubuntu works pretty good right out of the box when compared to gentoo
that's what I'm saying...
its named something else, maybe wlan0 or ra0
but "iwlist wlan1 scan" gave me the networks...
ifconfig wlan1 up worked aswell...
dmesg: "renamed network interface wlan0 to wlan1"
then im not sure what the problem is
